articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Hundreds of fighters from Iran-backed Iraqi militias crossed into Syria overnight to help the government fight rebels who seized Aleppo last week, Syrian and Iraqi sources said on Monday, and Tehran pledged to aid the Damascus government.
articles.title: Iraqi militias enter Syria to reinforce government forces, military sources say

articles.author: Jonathan Spicer
articles.description: Syrian rebel fighters began preparations to seize Aleppo a year ago but the operation was delayed by war in Gaza and ultimately launched last week when a ceasefire took hold in Lebanon, the head of Syria's main opposition abroad told Reuters.
articles.title: Syrian opposition leader says Lebanon truce opened door to Aleppo assault

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police in Georgia fired water cannon and tear gas to disperse protesters in Tbilisi, the capital, who opposed the government's decision to suspend talks on joining the European Union, while some were detained, Russian agencies said on Monday.
articles.title: Georgia police fire tear gas to scatter protesters, Russian agencies say

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces bombarded houses in overnight attacks in the northern Gaza Strip, killing at least 15 people in one of the buildings in the town of Beit Lahiya, Palestinian medics said on Monday.
articles.title: Israeli army bombards homes in north Gaza, airstrike kills 15, medics say

articles.author: Elizabeth Pineau, Dominique Vidalon
articles.description: Prime Minister Michel Barnier dropped planned cuts to medication reimbursements in a last-minute bid to get his 2025 budget bill over the line.
articles.title: France's Barnier makes last-minute concession to far right in bid to avoid being toppled

articles.author: Hamuda Hassan, Ahmed Fahmy
articles.description: When a ceasefire between Israel and Hezbollah came into effect last week, Lebanese hotelier Abbas al-Tannoukhi leapt at the chance to bury a dead relative in their southern hometown of Khiyam, battered for weeks by intense clashes.
articles.title: With Israeli tanks on the ground, Lebanese unable to bury dead

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanese armed group Hezbollah does not currently intend to send fighters to northern Syria to support the Syrian army there, three sources familiar with the Iran-backed group's thinking told Reuters on Monday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Hezbollah not intending to send fighters to Assad in Syria for now, sources say

articles.author: Saliou Samb, Bate Felix
articles.description: Some fans threw stones, triggering panic and a crush, a government statement said, promising an investigation.
articles.title: Guinea stadium crush kills 56 people after disputed refereeing decision

articles.author: Ricardo Brito, Adriano Machado
articles.description: The involvement of Indigenous people in illegal gold hunting, lured by the prospect of easy money due to record prices, has made Brazil's task of cracking down on wildcat mining in the Amazon far harder, environmental agents and police say.
articles.title: Indigenous mining complicates Brazil's fight against illegal gold

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Palestinian militant group Hamas said on Monday that 33 hostages had been killed during the almost 14-month-old war with Israel in Gaza, without clarifying their nationalities.
articles.title: Hamas says 33 hostages killed during war in Gaza
